unnormalised: **Question:** What are some effective yoga practices I can incorporate into my daily routine for overall well-being?
normalised: **Question:** What are some effective yoga practices I can incorporate into my daily routine for overall well-being?

unnormalised: Okay, so as someone who grew up watching my grandmother, Dadi, perform her daily Suryanamaskar near the tulsi plant, I’ve always been surrounded by yoga. It's more than just stretching; it's a way of life.
normalised: Okay, so as someone who grew up watching my grandmother, Dadi, perform her daily Suryanamaskar near the tulsi plant, I’ve always been surrounded by yoga. It's more than just stretching; it's a way of life.

unnormalised: For overall well-being, I'd suggest starting with the basics. A few rounds of Suryanamaskar are a fantastic way to warm up the body. Follow that with asanas like Trikonasana, Bhujangasana, and Adho Mukha Svanasana (Downward-Facing Dog). Even holding each pose for just 30 seconds can make a huge difference.

unnormalised: Don't underestimate the power of Pranayama! Kapalabhati (Skull Shining Breath) can really energize you in the morning. For relaxation, try Anulom Vilom (Alternate Nostril Breathing). I remember learning it in my NCC camp way back when.
normalised: Don't underestimate the power of Pranayama! Kapalabhati (Skull Shining Breath) can really energize you in the morning. For relaxation, try Anulom Vilom (Alternate Nostril Breathing). I remember learning it in my N C C camp way back when.

unnormalised: I also find that incorporating some restorative yoga poses before bed really helps me sleep better. Child's Pose or Legs-up-the-Wall pose are excellent. If you’re looking for guidance, institutions like the Morarji Desai National Institute of Yoga in Delhi offer excellent programs.

unnormalised: Remember, yoga is a journey, not a destination. Don’t push yourself too hard, especially when you're starting out. Even 15 minutes a day is better than nothing. It's like that dialogue from *Om Shanti Om*: "Kehte hain agar kisi cheez ko dil se chaho toh puri kainaat use tumse milane ki koshish mein lag jaati hai" – if you sincerely want something, the whole universe conspires to make it happen. Apply that dedication to your yoga practice! You'll see the benefits in no time, trust me!
